name: 2-(1,2-dihydroacenaphthylen-5-yl)-3-phenylquinoxaline
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3221
Reason: 1,2-dihydroacenaphthylen-5-yl and phenyl groups both add rigidity and molecular weight, with an estimated increase of +20°C due to the additional phenyl group and +10°C due to the 1,2-dihydroacenaphthylen-5-yl group. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The quinoxaline base itself has a melting point of around 100°C due to the presence of a planar, aromatic system with a high melting point. The methylene bridge introduces additional rigidity, estimated at +5°C. The fluorine atom raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at +5°C.
